basics.name: Gian Panoy
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2026.

work.summary: Internship at the County of Kauai, IT Department
highlights: Actively participated in making edits and updates to the Official County of Kauai website.
Go-to resource for colleagues in other departments, provided guidance and training to help them understand the editor's functionality and troubleshoot

work.position: Campus Athletic Facilities Events & Maintenance Crew
work.summary: Ground crew for sporting events and maintenace
highlights: Setup ticketing entrances and clean up waste and trash for UH home football games
Regularly maintain lower campus grounds and facilities

work.summary: Worked the front desk at local bowlling alley
highlights: Processed customer transactions and provided friendly service at the front counter
Performed lane maintenance by oiling and ensuring optimal playing conditions
Organized food and prepared food for distribution
Prepared newsletters to be sent to residents

awards.title: B+ Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarships awarded to incoming freshmen and continuing students who complete a rigorous high school curriculum with a minimum overall GPA of 3.0 at a Hawai'i public school.

awards.title: Deans's List
awards.summary: Earn a semester grade point average of 3.5 or higher based on 12 credits or more taken for a grade.
